ctree 0.1.1
  • Get started
  • Reference

Plot a ctree tree.

plot.ctree.Rd

This S3 method plots a ctree tree, using ggraph layout functions. The tree is annotated and coloured in each node (i.e., cluster) that contain a driver event annotated. The driver id is also reported via ggrepel annotation functions.

# S3 method for ctree
plot(x,
  node_palette = colorRampPalette(RColorBrewer::brewer.pal(n = 9,
  "Set1")), tree_layout = "tree", ...)

Arguments

x

A ctree tree.
node_palette

A function that applied to a number will return a set of colors. By default this is a colorRampPalette applied to 9 colours of the RColorBrewer palette Set1. Colors are generated following a topological sort of the information transfer, which is obtained from igraph.
tree_layout

A layout that can be used by tidygraph, which wraps igraph's layouts. By default this is a `tree` layout.
...

Extra S3 parameters

Value

A ggplot plot of the tree.

Examples

data('ctree_input')

x = ctrees(
   ctree_input$CCF_clusters,
   ctree_input$drivers,
   ctree_input$samples,
   ctree_input$patient,
   ctree_input$sspace.cutoff,
   ctree_input$n.sampling,
   ctree_input$store.max
   )
#>  [ ctree ~ generate clone trees for CUK12345 ] 
#> Sampler :  10000 (cutoff),  5000 (sampling),  100 (max store) 
#> # A tibble: 7 x 7
#>   cluster nMuts is.driver is.clonal    R1    R2    R3
#>   <chr>   <int> <lgl>     <lgl>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1 1          72 TRUE      FALSE      0     0.92  0   
#> 2 2          69 TRUE      TRUE       0.99  0.98  0.99
#> 3 3          48 FALSE     FALSE      0     0     0.49
#> 4 4          29 FALSE     FALSE      0.01  0.01  0.93
#> 5 5          24 TRUE      FALSE      0.78  0     0   
#> 6 6          23 TRUE      FALSE      0.98  0.03  0.98
#> 7 7          15 FALSE     FALSE      0     0.41  0   
#> 
#> ✔ Region R1  ~  #CCF clusters > 1%:  3 
#> ✔ Region R2  ~  #CCF clusters > 1%:  4 
#> ✔ Region R3  ~  #CCF clusters > 1%:  4 
#> ✔ Trees per region 1, 3, 1 
#> ✔ Hashed trees 5 
#> ✔ Structures 3 - search is exahustive 
#> ✔ Pigeonhole Principle  
#> ✔ Ranking trees  
#> ✔ Trees with non-zero sscore 3 storing 3 
#> 

plot(x[[1]])
#> Warning: Duplicated aesthetics after name standardisation: na.rm
#> Warning: Removed 1 rows containing missing values (geom_point).
